issue.title: [CF 440] Additional animations
issue.body:
I'd really like some additional animations, since the current ones don't quite satisfy my ideas. The animation I'd like the most would be a colorable border like this:

http://i.imgur.com/4dBIP.png

But if you allowed costum files to be used to overlay that would enable me to do pretty much anything.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #440 | Raw

comments.body:
Added both icon border and image overlay. Let me know how they work.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

It seems to be working quite nicely upon initial review. Though the motive here was to have one bordercolor for when I should Heroic Strike and another for when I should Inner Rage. Now this doesn't need a priority system in order to work as I can just give the Heroic Strike icon the condition not to display when the Inner Rage Icon displays. It does however, from what I can tell, require for there to be more than one "Other Icon Show/Hide".


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

I've been wanting to rewrite events to allow multiple event handlers of the same type, or multiple outputs for an event (which could be accomplished by multiple event handlers for the same event) for a while. Now I have some incentive to do it, so I may start work on this fairly soon.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Its 2:00 AM and I'm finally done (for the most part). I still want to add a method (probably right click on an event handler) to change the event and/or type of a handler after it has been created.

That aside, venture forth and play with the new and much improved events!


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Wow, at first I thought, there are some menues missing here. Where is Text and Sound? But then... It is so undescribably beautiful :O

However there's bad news aswell.

This error occured in every single icon, meaning dozens if not hundreds of times:

``` Error occured in: Global Count: 3 Message: TellMeWhen: Group: 10, Icon: 37: ..\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua line 3105: attempt to index field '?' (a boolean value) Debug: TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:2464: Error() TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:4480: Setup() TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1577: TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1541 (tail call): ? [C]: ? [string "safecall Dispatcher[2]"]:9: [string "safecall Dispatcher[2]"]:5 (tail call): ? Ace3\AceTimer-3.0\AceTimer-3.0.lua:164: Ace3\AceTimer-3.0\AceTimer-3.0.lua:138 ```

This one occured once:

``` Message: ..\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua line 3105: attempt to index field '?' (a boolean value) Debug: [C]: ? TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:3105: method() TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1204: Fire() TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:4985: SetInfo() TellMeWhen\Types\meta.lua:156: OnUpdate() TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:4787: Update() TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1513: TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.lua:1464 ```

As an endresult TellMeWhen is completely busted.

Edited Feb 18, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Should be fixed now.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

The error messages are gone, however now there are different issues appearing. My main metaicon doesn't appear until I cast a spell and animations don't reliably trigger or hide. Not quite sure what to make of any of it.

Edited Feb 18, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Well, I just discovered a quite frightening bug relating to meta icons checking entire groups - perhaps this is part of the issue? Let me know if r464 did fix it, and if it didn't, then re-post the export string of your profile; the one that I have is quite old. I will let these screenshots speak for themselves:

A proper list of icons for a meta icon to check:

What was happening pre 464:

Edited Feb 18, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Just discovered another bug involving icons with multiple OnIconShow/OnIconHide conditions.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I start on some fixes to a bunch of things, bot had to run out for a few hours. I will finish them up in a bit. Among these fixes is:

Multiple OnIconShow, OnIconHide, OnDuration, OnAlpha[Inc/Dec], or OnStack events on an icon dont work correctly.

Duration thresholds for OnDuration events are broken (or, at least the config is)


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Everything should be working 100% at this point. Let me know if it isn't.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

There is still something going on with the condition "target reaction". I think icons don't check if any of their conditions have changed when you select or deselect a target.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Hmm.... It seems to be working OK for me. Could you post the export string of an icon that you can reproduce this with? Also, could you tell me the exact environment in which you are able to test this (E.g. when not in combat, clear your target, then target a hostile mob, then target yourself. Note that there is a difference between hostile and neutral, and between neutral attackable and neutral non-attackable)

The gist of the mechanic is this: When I'm between 60 and 90 rage I want a yellow border, when I am between 90 and 100 I want a red border. So the idea was to have one trigger start a yellow animation when I entered the 60-90 range and another to stop all animations when I left it and the same for the 90-100 range. However what would often happen then when I crossed from below 90 to above 90 or the other way around was that the addon would first register that I had entered a new range and then register that I had left another, causing it to trigger an animation based on entering range B and then immediately stopping all animations based on leaving range A. If it fired the events in the opposite order everything would be fine.

By adding a third icon here I was able to make sure that triggers for new animations would always be delayed long enough for the triggers stopping old animations to fire first. However it took me about an hour to wrap my brain around the logic of this. So while I'm fine, I dread for the less experienced users to come up against this problem.

@Cybeloras: Go

Maybe I can make the problem a little clearer. I have two icons A and B, which have to be mutually exclusive. The way I did this was I made it a condition of icon A that B be hidden, that way B would always hide A and A would come back again as soon as B went away. This would lead to the following chain of events:

-B becomes visible

  • New animation triggered
  • Hide icon A triggered

-New animation starts/Icon A hides

  • Stop all animations triggered

-New animation stops after just having been triggered a fraction of a second ago.

Again, this might just be a fringe issue and I have found myself around it. I'm just pointing out the potential weaknesses of the "stop all animations"-animation.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

I was just about to say unable to reproduce @ #17, but then I realized what you meant. Icons that are being listening to in an OnIconShow/Hide event won't have their updates run by the update engine if they are set to always hide because it thinks that the icon is completely unused.

(r470) Icons that are being watched by On Icon Show/Hide events should now always be registered with the icon update engine to ensure that the icons that depend on these events function as expected

Do you think you could make it so the opacity of an animation attached to a metaicon doesn't change with the icon the metaicon is currently displaying?

Edited Mar 10, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

I assume you are referring to animations that overlay something on the icon (icon border, image overlay, activation border) (as opposed to the alpha flash and the fade in/out animations, which would be a definite no).

Its a bit of a tricky situation because the alpha of an icon is what governs whether or not an icon is shown or hidden. If I separate the animation from the icon, then there would end up being weird bugs with the animation being shown even while the icon is hidden. Perhaps the best way to implement this would be to add an option that would allow you to only change the alpha of the icon texture, leaving every other part of the icon shown at 100% (including text overlays, animations, and Masque borders/highlights/gloss/whatever)
